FuncDef:
The bypass-vxlan enable command enables the inter-chassis VXLAN function for an EVPN instance.
The undo bypass-vxlan enable command disables the inter-chassis VXLAN function from an EVPN instance.
The bypass-vxlan disable command disables the inter-chassis VXLAN function from an EVPN instance.
The undo bypass-vxlan disable command enables the inter-chassis VXLAN function for an EVPN instance.
By default, if the inter-chassis VXLAN function is enabled both in the global EVPN view and in the EVPN instance view, the configuration in the global EVPN view takes effect.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, after the bypass-vxlan enable command is globally configured, a device can be deployed only with the EVPN VXLAN-related functions. If users want to configure EVPN MPLS-related functions for some BD-EVPN instances, run the bypass-vxlan disable command to disable the inter-chassis VXLAN function from these BD-EVPN instances.
Precautions
By default, if the inter-chassis VXLAN function is enabled both in the global EVPN view and in the BD-EVPN instance view, the configuration in the global EVPN view takes effect. If the inter-chassis VXLAN function is disabled in the BD-EVPN instance view, the configuration in the BD-EVPN instance view takes effect.
